channel.title: INfinance
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INfinance, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Wildfires and Other Disasters Push Up Home-Insurance Rates Thousands of Miles Away
item.description: With insured losses ballooning, home insurance rates in places like Vermont and Virginia are rising, too.

item.title: My wife and I passed on a family wedding due to a ‘no-child’ rule. We’re now attending a friend’s nuptials without our kids. Are we hypocrites?
item.description: “My in-laws are coming to watch our 7-year-old daughter and her 2-year-old sister.”

item.title: World’s largest chip maker, Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing, reports record sales
item.description: The key supplier of advanced chips for the world’s leading tech companies saw record revenue in the final quarter of 2023.

item.title: The U.K. Is the Biggest Loser From the Rise in Yields
item.description: The magnitude of the selloff served as a reminder that rising borrowing costs will have consequences for highly indebted governments.

item.title: TikTok ban goes before Supreme Court. Here’s where the app’s $10 billion in ad revenue could go if it dies.
item.description: The end of TikTok in the U.S. could mean a sizeable boost for its publicly traded American competitors.

item.title: S&P 500, Nasdaq Futures Fall
item.description: Stock futures were lower as Investors stayed on edge ahead of the December nonfarm payrolls report.

item.title: U.K. Gilt Selloff Stems Only Partly from Home-Grown Problems
item.description: Ten-year gilt yields edged up and HSBC said global uncertainty and fears of sticky inflation were among the culprits behind their rise on Thursday to ...

item.title: Euro Undervalued, Could Outperform Peers After U.S. Jobs Data
item.description: The euro was up slightly against the dollar, while ING said the European currency’s undervaluation meant it could have less scope to fall than other G...

item.title: Treasury yields rise ahead of payrolls report
item.description: U.S. bond yields rose on Friday ahead of pivotal data on the jobs market.

item.title: Goldman’s top economist doubts Trump can make good on campaign promises
item.description: Goldman Sachs chief economist Jan Hatzius is bullish on the outlook for the U.S. economy, in large part because he doubts Donald Trump’s incoming admi...
